alert.note: Alert for Baltimore City (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:32AM EST until December 18 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DC, including the following , District of Columbia and Maryland, including the following counties, Anne Arundel, Baltimore City, Howard, Montgomery and Prince Georges. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1232 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. A few river gauges are nearing flood stage and are expected to reach that shortly. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Bowie... Severn... Annapolis... Clinton... College Park... Crofton... Fort Washington... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Elkridge... Riviera Beach... Forestville... Largo... Coral Hills... Bladensburg... Mayo... Shady Side... Deale... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
